doc.name: hilitedIcon

syntax.example: set the hilitedIcon of button to {imageID | imageName}

doc.summary: Specifies an image to display in a button when the button is highlighted.

examples.example: set the hilitedIcon of button "Management" to 343

description.p: Use the hilitedIcon property to change a button's appearance when it is highlighted.
The hilitedIcon property is the ID or name of an image to use for an icon. LiveCode looks for the specified image first in the current stack, then in other open stacks.
By default, the hilitedIcon property of newly created buttons is set to zero.
When the button is highlighted, the hilitedIcon is displayed within the button's rectangle.
The hilitedIcon keyword was introduced in version 1.1. In previous versions, the hiliteIcon synonym was used.
